I was told that the place was of Western style cuisine, so don't expect the place to give you the typical asian dishes you find in Chinese restaurants. I came on a Saturday afternoon with my partner and the place was not extremely packed. We were taken to our tables and the waiter was quite quick to get our order. 

I ordered curry chicken with rice while my partner ordered the honey glazed pork chop. The curry tasted quite sweet, and not as curry-ish as I had expected. The chicken was alright when combined with the curry. The rice, however, was quite dry. Having it with curry didn't make it much better. As for my friend's pork chop - it tasted quite bland. It was served with cranberry sauce, which was not a good combination for my friends taste. His dish also came with steamed vegetables - which were basically frozen vegetables. They were also, quite bland. I think the only part I liked from his plate was the cranberry sauce. The portion was pretty large for both our dishes, but for the quality was a bit of a disappointment. 

Here is the main reason why we came for a visit: Dessert! I was told from my friend (we are both avid dessert lovers) His favourite being the Mango Meringue Cake offered at Maxim. However, he did warn me the cakes are sometimes really good  and sometimes average (inconsistent quality). When we tried it, the meringue was quite delicious. However, there was so much cream and not that much mango bits. So, the proportion didn't fit quite well, so the experience wasn't anything special for me. They have other cakes though. I would give them a try again, if I ever visit Toronto again. But perhaps not for the meals.

name: Maxim Bakery & Restaurant
text:
I came here recently twice for a weekend lunch and dinner. Both times I was equally satisfied with the service and food. Water was filled without you having to ask and there were enough waiters to serve everyone. 

I would classify Maxim as a more upscale HK style cafe because they have a lot of the dishes typically served in a regular HK style cafe. The two basic choices between cream and Russian borscht soup also makes me feel this way. There is plenty of variety on the menu like sandwiches, soups, salads, burgers, pasta, curry, rice, steak, lamb and, of course, cakes as they are a bakery. They have regular lunch combos if you want to be frugal, or you can spice things up with more expensive lunch or dinner specials with the choice of salad or lobster bisque as an appetizer and a slice of cake as dessert. 

For lunch I ordered some smoked salmon with shrimp pasta which was one of the lunch specials of the day with Russian borscht soup. The free bread they give you with the soup is not good at all. Very tasteless and cold. The actual soup itself was pretty good and I preferred it over the cream soup I also tried. The portion of the pasta was about average and the sauce used was not very good. However, I was able to eat the food from what my party ordered because their portions were much bigger. I really liked their Caesar salad and mashed potatoes. The deluxe club sandwich was really big and unfortunately, it was a hassle to eat because bits of tuna kept falling out. The Black Forest cake they picked out for me to eat was not to my liking, but that's only because I prefer more sweet cakes.

For dinner I ordered lamb chop with lobster bisque. The soup was made in a HK style which meant the lobster flavour was much more mild than if you were to have it at a typical western restaurant. The lamb was good quality and there was minimal amount of salt, pepper and seasoning which is what I prefer because you get a more clearer taste of the lamb. Others might find it too devoid of seasoning. Maybe it was because the restaurant was almost closing and they had to get rid of their cakes, but they let me choose what type of cake I could have for dessert this time. During my previous lunch visit, I was told there would be an extra $2 charge if I wanted to pick the cake out myself. I chose the mango cheesecake which was not very sweet again, but I guess that ends up being healthier.

All in all, this place has existed for a very long time (25+ years?) for a good reason. You might have to wait for a table on weekends. I would recommend Maxim for lunch and dinner and not for the cakes.

name: Maxim Bakery & Restaurant
text: Great meringue cakes, not a place id go eat with my family, but i dont go anywhere else for meringue

name: Maxim Bakery & Restaurant
text:
First Time: Very tastey and clean. Yeah. Finally. Mango cake was good...Second time was a little disappointing. Haven't been back since 

-.-  -.-

name: Maxim Bakery & Restaurant
text: I really like the food here.  It costs a bit more than other asian restaurants that offer similar higher end western food,  but the cakes at this place are awesome.  I usually like to pick up birthday cakes here because they are that good!

name: Maxim Bakery & Restaurant
text:
For the cakes, 5 stars.

For the meals - not so much. 

I ordered the roasted lamb and was disappointed that is was not seasoned enough. After two bites, I pushed away my meal and sampled my friend's orders. It takes a very dull meal to stop me from at least attempting to eat it.

From what I tasted, one out of the four orders was appetizing.

Now on to the cakes. The cakes were very good. I would almost wish this restaurant specialized in cakes and desserts. That or bring up the standard of the meal to that of the cakes.

name: Maxim Bakery & Restaurant
text: Their meringue is not as good as the other location. Other cakes are similar. Set meals are reasonable with price and consistent quality of food. However, if I have a choice, I would prefer the other location at Finch.

name: Maxim Bakery & Restaurant
text: Great food ! It was well presented and a great deal for the price , I recommend it ! No complaints rlly , service was good and everyone was polite .

name: Maxim Bakery & Restaurant
text:
Brought 2 cakes here early Sept.

(1) Black Forest 
(2) Lemon Something

Both were nice, I remember it being better..

name: Maxim Bakery & Restaurant
text: Thanks for saving the day Maxims! My wife's favorite cake was discontinued & deemed a seasonal cake from my usual spot in Scarborough AND La Roca. Without calling & ordering ahead, I was able to walk in & pick from an assortment of ready made cakes & found a 10" strawberry merengue for way cheaper. Needless to say, I solidified my super hero status on my wife's birthday & I'll be dropping in tomorrow, just because it's a Tuesday. I'd recommend this spot to friends & family for any occasion, thanks again.

name: Maxim Bakery & Restaurant
text: Love their cakes! The lunch or afternoon tea is better than the dinner. They give hot water instead of ice water to customers and that is the part I like. If they can make better milk tea or coffees, I will give them five stars.

name: Maxim Bakery & Restaurant
text:
* Food is average and well presented
* Cakes are really delicious
* Place is neatly decorated and looks clean
* Average priced
* Decent service and can get busy at times

name: Maxim Bakery & Restaurant
text: I had a very good experience. The food was hot and served relatively quick despite it being very busy that day with only 2 servers. The food was tasty, and filling. The price is very very good. The meal came with a slice of cake of your choosing afterward, from their large selection of cakes. Very pleasant little bistro in Richmond Hill.

name: Maxim Bakery & Restaurant
text: Ive had their strawberry meringue cake here twice. I love its flavour and textures combined and love that its too sweet or hard. The price is decent and I go out of my way to get the cake because you cant get it anywhere else to my knowledge. Be careful if you are ordering any of the other cakes as many include rum inside as an ingredient.

name: Maxim Bakery & Restaurant
text:
Really disappointed. Seated over an hour and our food still wasn't there. The server made it seems like our fault for asking about our food. I guess it is a custom for customers to wait for food. 

Some of us received our food and found that the food was different from what we ordered. The server just say they ran out and did not inform us before hand.  

Also, the tip was calculated on the bill already and I honestly think the service wasn't worth the 15% paid! 

A simple apology for the long wait would avoid the disappointment. No matter how good the food, bad service will always turn clients away! 

Good for cake but never for food!

name: Maxim Bakery & Restaurant
text:
I ordered the lamb chop and much to my delight I actually receive part of a rack of lamb. Succulent. Broccoli soup was delicious. Service was superb. Atmosphere is at the same time classy but with a family feel. 

Don't miss the desserts. Can't be beat.

name: Maxim Bakery & Restaurant
text:
Went in for a nice lunch with my mother and it was alright. So we got the lunch specials which was around 10 to 14 dollars. Each came with bread and soup. 

The bread appeared to be home made and was extremely good. Crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. The soup wasn't hot however, it was slightly warm.

The meal itself was alright. I got the black pepper chicken and the chicken was tender AF HOLLLLLY. IT WAS GOOD. came with a salad and 2 spring roles. 

Hostess gave us free cake which was also amazing!

Would come again!

name: Maxim Bakery & Restaurant
text:
Tried their set dinner. It's a good value meal; with soup, entree, dessert and coffee/tea all around the mid $20s range. 

I would want to come back for their weekday lunch deals at $14.95 which include appetizer, main course, a piece of cake, and coffee/tea. Weekends are $1 more. 

Nice service, spacious, and clean. The best part is it's one of the rare Chinese run restaurants that are not noisy. :p

name: Maxim Bakery & Restaurant
text:
This is strictly the review of their online order advertised on their website.  I ordered a cake on Sept 22 for the 8" strawberry meringue cake for pick up on Sept 27.  Ideally, I would like another email to confirm my order is ready for pick up other than the acknowledgement that my order was placed. Anyways, when I arrived on the 27 to get the cake, none of the staff there knew about it. I had to show them my order ( btw that was already paid by cc from their online order system). And they had to scramble for 5 minutes to ask other staff if they had my order.  One of them finally called the owner I guess to confirm that my order was placed.  Luckily, they had the cake available for me to pick up but that's only because they made a bunch to sell for their display case. If I had come later during the day I'm sure they wouldn't have the cake I wanted available.  Not only that,i had indicated on my order to write"happy birthday" on the cake the staff said because of the cake I ordered, they couldn't write it on the cake and had to charge me an extra 50 cents to write it on a piece of chocolate.  ***Guess what, look at Nathan's Aug 19 2016 review, the cake he ordered they were able to write on the cake***

Our family has been coming here for the past 15 years on special occasions and this experience left a bad taste in my mouth.  Definitely wont be coming back after this!

name: Maxim Bakery & Restaurant
text:
5 stars for their famous mango meringue cake. It's heavenly!
Truth be told: that's the only thing I buy here.
Maybe one day I'll try something else... Maybe.

name: Maxim Bakery & Restaurant
text:
It is Sunday at noon and is Mother's Day.  When first stepped into the restaurant, it does not have too many people.  But not an hour later it is filled and packed.  

The service is all you can say like a fast food restaurant.  The server expects you to know what to order if it is your turn.  Be quick and precise, not to hesitate.  

The food though maintains its standard.  Each of the different dishes that our group has tried has a good comment.  The club sandwich is large and thick, enough to fill up any person together with fries.  The ox tail rice unexpectedly the ox tail is cut into very thick pieces so it looks piling up on the rice.  The ox tail is very well cooked and tender but the tip you can still taste a bit of the raw tail - can be done better.  The chicken comes with a salad and rice and the portion is large.  The Borsch is tasty and a bit too much tomato paste.  Most of the sauces are really thick and can fill your stomach really fast.

The lunch serving is very slow, may be due to the number of customers.

name: Maxim Bakery & Restaurant
text:
My family and I always come here for their cakes whenever it's a special occasion (birthday, Mother's day, Father's day etc.). The 8" cake is $32 and the 6" is around $22-$24. They have a large selection of cakes ranging from Tiramisu, Cheesecakes, Meringues, Fruit Cakes to Strawberry Shortcakes! Usually we get their green tea or New York Cheesecakes, and you can never go wrong with them, the Cheesecakes are always delicious and never too heavy.

On our latest visit to this location, my family really wanted to the 8" mango meringue cake but unfortunately we didn't pre order it, so the one on display had been served to customers by the piece. Thankfully, there was also a strawberry meringue that was being served by the piece too and the owner was nice enough to combine what was left of the two into one whole cake! The meringue was amazing, I don't think there's anywhere else where you can get a meringue of this quality, it was nice and fluffy as well as very flavourful. This is a great cake place!

name: Maxim Bakery & Restaurant
text:
Very poor service on a busy Sunday afternoon. 

Our waiter did not write down our selections and tried to keep it all in his mind. (9 people). He mixed up our orders and forgot one dish. He came back and said I have 3 dish 'a'. 2 dish 'b' etc. But as we didn't know what each other ordered, We had to talk amonsgt ourselves to find what he missed. 

A problem that could have been solved if he just wrote down our orders!!

All our meals came with a choce of soup. A choice that was denied to us. He just came out and brought some soups until someone from our group said 'so we don't get a choice?'. Only then did he say 'oh ya, you can also have the borsht if you want.'

The cream of asparagus soup was a bit thick and clearly sat out and was reheated (thick soup skin). 

Bread was cold too.   

Fettuccine bolognese was good looking; slightly oversauced. but again bad service ensued when he just shoved a fork into my plate. No 'excuse me'. Not putting it to the side. 

Another consequence of bad order taking is the wrong dishes were delivered to the wrong people.

Other mains are pork chop, beef brisket, florentine. All were average.

We had all finished and after a while we had to ask for our drinks. Another mark of poor service. No water refills at all. 

Service 0/5
Value for money 3/5
Overall sarisfaction after meal 3/5

name: Maxim Bakery & Restaurant
text: This place always seem to be empty when I go to pick up some cake.  I had dinner here once and it was okay.  It is more pricey than other Chinese restaurants.  I usually just come here when I have a sweet tooth - They have a good selection of cakes.  I tried most of their cakes - Cheesecake, Mango cake, Chocolate Grand Marnier and Strawberry meringue are my favorite.  It is around $4.50 a slice of cake but the portion is not that big.  8" meringue cake cost around $28 plus tax which is a little expensive.

name: Maxim Bakery & Restaurant
text:
I was in the plaza here because of Bruno's and me and my bf were hungry afterwards.  The options, it appeared, were either a Japanese restaurant which the counter attendant at Bruno's said was not too bad, or Maxim. Well, we searched trusty Yelp and Maxim's was described as a Cafe serving French food. That was exactly what I was craving for and so we went in.

The lady asked me, in Cantonese, how many people and I was taken aback for a quick moment. I then realized this could be the same Maxims near my home...great for cakes, but so-so on everything else.

Service is awful here, in that it is very slow. They also do forget things. We came here Saturday around 3-ish so it wasn't prime time exactly. The food on the other hand was okay. I had the chicken which was covered in a great gravy, served with crunchy green beans (just the way I like them). My bf had the fish and chips which tasted like the best microwave oven fish ever! Crispy and crunchy on the outside, and fluffy white fish meat on the inside. The fries were yummy too!

Of course, we had the cakes for dessert and my fave is the Strawberry Meringue and Strawberry Shortcake:)

Overall though, I wouldn't recommend this place if you're hungry or if you're in a rush. The good thing is if you just want to be left alone and not have server's coming to see if your cup is empty or if you want more food, then this is your place.

They do serve alcohol (white and red wine) although there is no menu for it. Also, my bf originally wanted the kids menu fish and chips portion as he wasn't hungry, but they wouldn't accommodate which meant we got the regular serving (2 HUGE pieces of fried fish).

name: Maxim Bakery & Restaurant
text:
Though run by Chinese, Maxim is not a Chinese style Western bistro.  It is an upscale casual bistro that happens to be run by Chinese.  And with this arrangement, Maxim offers exceptional value when compared to other casual fine dining establishments.  

Upon entry, I noticed the dim lighting, the white clothed tables, the pleasant and tasteful decoration and, you can't miss it, a wide selection of cakes in a refrigerated display case.

We ordered from the set dinner menu a Pickled Pork Hock with Sauerkraut and Potato ($19) and a Maxim's Mixed Grills ($22). Both came with roll and butter, starter soup, a piece of cake of your choice and a hot beverage. The Pork Hock was well portioned.  It was the size of a baseball (see pic). The flavour was bold, though not as complicated as the authentic pork hock at The Muskets. The meat was very juicy. The flavour was unfortunately one dimensional, but the tenderness and the juiciness of the meat made up for it. The Mixed Grills had a mix of steak, pork, sausage, and lamp chops (see pic). My BF said they chops were all tender and flavourful, though maybe salty for some. The cut of the meat was good.

I eagerly awaited the dessert because the cakes looked so pretty in the refrigerated display case.  There were maybe 10 types to choose from.  Patrons were expected to choose by viewing the case and ordered it through a wait staff back at table.  My BF chose a slice of Cappuccino Meringue and I chose a slice of Blueberry Almond Meringue.  I must say the Cappuccino Meringue was the better of the two.  

Is Maxim good? Yes, food tastes decent.  Is Maxim a good deal?  Oh 200% yes, if you order from the set menu.  The regular menu is rather pricey.  Is Maxim French?  I am not sure.  It tastes more continental to me.  The service was efficient and sufficient, yet definitely not refine by the standard of a casual fine dining restaurant.

Maxim is a solid choice if I feel like enjoying a Western meal in class but don't want to hurt my wallet too much.

name: Maxim Bakery & Restaurant
text:
This is a good bakery/restaurant/cafe.

They feature a wide variety of "french style" baked good and a pretty decent menu for dining. They bake a lot of cheese  cakes: lemon, NY, Mango, Mocha, Mixed Fruit, Green Tea, Chocolate Grand Marnier, and Strawberry.

The also have the standards: Saint Honore, Viennese Chocolate, Chestnut Cake (layered with imported chestnut puree), and a slew of differently flavoured meringue cakes.

This is the place to take your date or significant other for some deep soulful looks, as you contemplate the universe, or more prosaically, the next few hours to come. Just like Soma, (no sexism intended), it is more a 'chick's place' than a man's. I tried to propose there, it's that kind of place.

But if you have a sweet tooth give them a whirl. I am partial to the fruit flan and the hazelnut chocolate mousse.

name: Maxim Bakery & Restaurant
text: I love their Mango Meringue Cake. The strawberry is a bit sweeter than the mango. Very fresh and great for occasions

name: Starbucks
text:
I love coming  here. Been going to Starbucks since the first store opened in Vancouver.  Always greeted with a big smile! Best coffee ever! !!!! 

Love the large patio during hot summer days and evenings. 

My 5 year old also loves coming here and orders her own hot chocolate the way she likes it and the staff always make sure to make it her way! 

All the staff are wonderful at this location!

name: Starbucks
text: Cute Starbucks... more seating than most plus a patio. Pretty clean for the most part. The staff is very friendly and nice. Not busy at all (Friday evening).

name: Starbucks
text:
I was there today to get a Caramel Latte. The coffee was delicious and good quality. Staff is very friendly and It's located in a great place.
The reason why I give only 3 stars is because the chairs inside are very uncomfortable.  They are wooden bar stools and I couldn't be seated on it for more than 3 minutes. Its not a relaxing coffee experience at all if you sit on one of their wooden stools. You could probably get more comfortable on a toilet seat than these stools for a cup of coffee. Everything else is fine.

name: Starbucks
text:
I love this place! The staff is ALWAYS friendly and helpful. My favourite time to come is summer. I can sit on the patio with my laptop and catch some rays. My only complaint is that the wifi is hard to hook up at times unless you sit close to the window.

Otherwise, I highly recommend this place. They really know how to treat their customers and keep them coming back!

name: Starbucks
text:
My rating is solely based on their performance against other Starbucks.  

The service was fast enough and everything was fresh as usual.   It just doesn't deserve 5 stars as the staff here don't add the personal touch like some other Starbucks do.  

In the summer the outdoor patio is amazing for relaxing and people watching, as liberty village is always buzzing.

name: Starbucks
text:
This Starbucks gets quite busy during peak coffee times, and always has people inside...ALWAYS. 

The staff are super friendly, quick and helpful. They rarely run out of products, flavours, etc. and it's a nice place to sit. 

They also have a nice patio where you can sit and enjoy the weather on warmer days.

name: Starbucks
text:
This is one of my favourite starbucks, because of their friendly staff, big outdoor patio in the summer and all the starbucks bonanza offered inside. 

It's also spacious inside and the food offered is always fresh.

name: Starbucks
text: Great staff -always friendly and fast. One of the best patios for enjoying the sun and your beverage while people watching

name: Starbucks
text:
Love this Starbucks!

Located in Liberty Village, the Starbucks on Hanna Ave. is clean, posh and located minutes away from the Exhibition GO Station. Orders are made to your liking, and the staff are quick and attentive. I swear, there is hardly ever a line up.

Additionally, the Starbucks has a lot of seating available, and a patio which is quite enjoyable during the summer after a Toronto FC soccer game.

name: Starbucks
text: I bought Espresso there and asked for the lightest espresso roast in a fine grind. The counter attendant asked if I wanted a breakfast blend (that is coffee). I was given the espresso in a paper bag with green electrical tape. I asked if I could have a freshness bag they said no. I had to ask why. Then the agent said because I did not buy a full pound (that would have change my purchase amount if I would have known that). I then asked again if the espresso was a fine grind because it felt kinda rocky in the bag and I just wanted to confirm I was getting what I asked for (I have MS and I do not have a lot of feeling in my hands). I then left and went home and gave the espresso to my husband and he opened the bag and said this is a course grind. I was very disappointed. Their espresso is expensive and it was a gift.

name: Starbucks
text: This is probably one of the best Starbucks in the area. Located in Liberty village and is staffed with about 4-5 people. The service is great here and they always ensure your order is right.

name: Starbucks
text: so disappointed! the icing on the top of my chocolate loaf stuck to the bottom of the pastry bag... someone needs to learn how to put pastries in a bag properly... decaf americano was ok.... staff was friendly...

name: Starbucks
text:
This is a pretty nice Starbucks.  Patio in the summertime, quick courteous staff.  

Close to work for me so and extra plus :)

name: Starbucks
text:
It's a Starbucks, with the same problems and benefits that every Starbucks has. The coffee is the same as every other starbucks, and they never seem to use separate containers for soy and dairy frappuccinos but they are quick, there is lots of seating, and a good collection of power outlets at this location (you just have to find them)

Overall, it's always clean, some of the staff are reasonably friendly.

name: Starbucks
text: Wasn't happy because the last 2 times I ordered my decaf grande pumpkin spice latte with soy milk, they definitely messed up my order and did not give me caffeine free coffee. I mentioned this to the staff on my last visit and they did not charge me for my drink and they even added a special touch by designing a flower into my drink.

name: Starbucks
text: Nice location near all the shopping in East Liberty village. Close to the 24 hour Metro grocery store.

name: Starbucks
text:
A 1st class Starbucks, in my humble opinion. It has everything you expect, including friendly staff who remember regulars' names & favourites. 

Small but nice patio, perfect for people watching in Liberty Village.

name: Starbucks
text:
ok I usually don't write reviews for mass chain restaurants/cafes, but this visit was so different I had to write a review plus I told them that I'm gonna write a review on yelp=)) 

so we stopped by after yelp masquerade party to get some hot coffee goodness.

I took cinnamon apple cider and then Antonio couldn't choose which syrup to add to his americano. so the waiter (awesome waiter Mike) offered toffeenut, vs hazelnut that was chosen at the beginning. after Antonio hesitated for few minutes Mike offered to split the tall cup into two shorts with hazelnut syrup in one and toffeenut in the other. such a cool and spontaneous offer=) loved it=) and yeah toffeenut is the way to go=)

also lots of seating and few comfy looking couches - always a plus. 

otherwise a regular starbucks.

name: Starbucks
text: This location is a fair size, however you will often have to wait in line given it is a very busy spot. The waitstaff seems nice, and a lot of locals seem to know the staff and vice a versa - don't expect to go in and be able to find a table as this location is always busy. Washrooms are spacious and have change tables for kids. There is free parking around the area for 20 minutes. Otherwise you will need to pay.

name: Starbucks
text:
Probably  one  of the busiest  Starbucks in the west end being  located  right in Liberty Village. 

This  location  is well staffed with usually  4 - 5 people behind  the counter serving/preparing orders.   They're  always friendly,  fast and efficient.  Sometimes  a bit too bubbly  for the morning,  but that's definitely  okay with me because I  am usually  full of adrenaline after my gym workout.  Therefore, the cheerfulness  is absolutely  welcome.

Love  coming  here  especially after my Saturday  morning  workouts when I want to treat myself occasionally to a mocha latte as it's  usually  not too busy and there's  usually  no more than two  people  in front  of me.

Being  in Liberty  Village, it's  definitely  a great place for people watching.

name: Starbucks
text: Ever since my favourite Starbucks location has closed down (Queen and Dovercourt), I've been looking for another starbucks location that will be as awesome as the one that closed down. Starbucks in liberty village is a hit or a miss. Depends on what time I go there. If it's earlier in the morning, it's fantastic. If it's the weekend, it's always rushed. My drink is always great.

name: Fye
text:
This store has gone through some management changes and has suffered in the past, no longer! This store is packed with new and used music, movies and games. 

I find the staff to be helpful and friendly, I feel like they appreciate my business. This is a cool neighborhood "old school" place to shop for tunes and movies. 

Give it a shot, you will not be disappointed.

name: Fye
text: I used to go to the f.y.e. in Tempe a lot for some cheap used CD blu-ray and some electronics. They closed recently so I had to travel far here. The girl cashier was really nice. The speaker I was getting has old discount price tags on them (which should be taken down already), but she still gave me the discount. All in all it's a nice place for us poor students. I hope they stay strong in the digital age.

name: Fye
text: Okay, we're old school.  I still like to peruse for old CD's and DVD's.  I don't trade, which I should.  I just donate the stuff I don't want.   So much cool stuff for kids here like games, accesories and even clothing.  My niece got a poster of what she called you're-not-cool-enough-to-know someone.  I was teasing my little cutie pie when I pickep up a Flash shirt then I knocked 30,000 times while saying "Penny".  The guy behind the counter smiled and said "I am obsessed with that show".  Cool, we are too.  Fun times.

name: Fye
text:
First time selling here and will be back here if we need to sell CDs. The staff was super nice and was patient with the crate load of CDs we had! I believe they pay more for CDs, my cousin sold to Zia and got way less. Also if you have some CDs you want to sell and want to see what the current selling price is, just go to the F.Y.E website, enter Cd name and they will give you a price for your CD! This came in very handy so you know which CDs you really wanna bring for the most buck!

Takes about 20-25 mins for them to process your stuff which is quick when your looking at all the cool stuff they have in the store. When they are down they give you an itemized receipt of all the CDs they bought from you so you know what they were worth in the end! I think my hubby teared a little letting some of those CDs, very proud of him for being able to let go hehe. Glad we came here though, and it's close to home! :)

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text:
I'm not one to give out compliments when they are not warranted. The TSA people here are too nice. I've been to airports all over the world. I think that I have seen examples of the best and worst of Airport security. I find these people up at the top. My evidence is this. My bag was segregated. When the TSA person pulled it off to go through it I stepped up and immediately saw the half empty bottle of water I threw in when I left for the airport that morning. I apologized and called myself a dope. The TSA person said no need , said I could drink the water and offered to throw it out. 

Nice crowd, friendly TSA agents and a great airport.

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text:
Dear Phoenix Sky Harbor TSA,

What a day. 

Unlike a lot of folks I encountered today, I'm a reasonable, calm lady. 

I'm not prone to lashing out or threatening harm upon a poor Southwest Customer Service Agent because God forbid the weather couldn't get me to my destination on time. 

Not being able to leave for Denver (I was scheduled to leave on SWA#1295, but cancelled at my client's request after several delays and him being unable to get on the road) because of the blizzard wasn't your fault. 

But I wanted to personally thank you for chipping a large part of the front of my night guard used for TMJ today (11/17). 

I rely on it to keep severe TMJ headaches and jaw pain at bay. 

One time my TMJ got so bad, it damn near completely locked my jaw and had to be prescribed heavy duty muscle relaxants just so 1) It could open and 2) So my dentist could see the damage.

This was a $300 dental appliance I've had for two years and had to pay 100% out of pocket because my insurance doesn't cover it.

In the future: When inspecting dental appliances in a passenger's bag, please handle with care. Night guards, retainers, etc. are NOT cheap to replace and aren't always covered by insurance. 

Seriously, break our make-up compacts all day. Just not the night guards!

Let's hope my dentist can help me with this. 

Signed, 

Nighttime Jaw Clencher Lady who's about to be in a LOT of pain. :'(

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: User be ware, they change the rules and do what they want. They couldn't follow their own rule book let along be capable of reading it. And for us PreCheck paying fools, they close the D gates early as well then won't recognize your PreCheck status unless you have a printed boarding pass so they say.As far as I'm concerned they are just another waste of tax payer/ the flying publics money. The funny thing is when I fly out of McCarron their PreCheck line is always open and I can get from car to gate in less than 15 minutes, Phoenix employees need to go and learn from a real busy airport how it works and how to treat PreChecked Americans!

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: I've been to a lot of airports and never write reviews but I felt I needed to this time. The security line was long and because they didn't have their TSA pre check line open there wasn't even an expedited line for TSA. The lady at the scanner was the rudest I've ever experienced and made snide remarks to me when I didn't even say anything to her. Not sure how these people are evaluated on a regular basis but apparently they aren't measured on customer service. Understand it's not meant to be a "friendly" job but they can at least be civil.

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: Got through with a double bladed immersion blender, 16oz of unidentified hair paste, an aresol can and a pair of scissors.  Agent was rude and miserable not to mention poorly educated.  Girlfriend traveling with me had a 2.5oz jar of wildflower honey removed from her.  Thank Christ... I now know the plane won't be hijacked by any honey jars.

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text:
Really disappointed, I know there are security procedures for a reason but when someone is wrong they should not be defensive and just admit to error. 
Coming in from Mexico I purchased 2 bottles of 3.4 ounces of vanilla not knowing I would be going thru TSA security again for my connecting flight home. I was told this was over the 3 oz limit and not able to go thru in my carry on. In my husbands bag there was an 8oz bottle of sunscreen, that passed security  just fine. When I questioned why his 8 oz bottle went thru just fine but my 3.4 was not both the TSA officer and the supervisor told me it was up to the agents discretion of what can pass and what can't. So then what's the point of having all these rules and regulations if it comes down to whomever lets whatever pass. An 8oz bottle of sunscreen vs 3.4 bottle of Mexican vanilla . Really !?!?! It feels like all this security is just a power struggle between officers and passengers instead of actually having a purpose of safety. 
BTW ..when I asked the original TSA agent about the option to check my bag she said it was a cost of $25, when the supervisor was talking to me he said a lot of times the airlines don't charge because they need the cabin space, however because I had already given up my item I could no longer get it back..so ya thanks for trying to make your wrong a right...but not really

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: Completely unprofessional and rude. This is not the first poor experience I have had with TSA but this is one of the most embarasing and humiliating experiences as I was treated like a criminal. I was exposed not only once, as I decline a private screening but, a second time in a required private screening. This is an unacceptable abuse of power.

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text:
Walked through infamous customer lacking service TSA security this morning and overheard two TSA management staff in conversation about a lady in security giving attitude. After my string of horrible experiences with the sky harbor TSA. I wanted to ask the smirky two TSA management staff leaning back on the machines. How their conversation and crisp entitled attitudes help create a better environment? If you trained your TSA staff better and had continuity in your screening processes. If you had clear viewable signs/website promoting your random weekly -if not daily security changes, so all passengers would not be caught off guard while going thru security. You may not have the passenger attitudes you create. I realize their are just stupid people who fly but the majority of the questionable stupidity and mind blowing self entitled, unreasonable attitudes center around and in TSA itself. 
I wonder if the older man before me who was randomly chosen for screening is still waiting for an agent to come over and open the screening cage? 
I've Been there before. Always a TSA cluster F***.

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text:
I traveled yesterday morning for a 7:04 a.m. flight. I entered into the security check point in plenty of time and selected the shortest line. The lines on each side seemed to flow seamlessly while my line moved at a snails pace. Just my luck. :) But that isn't my biggest concern. 

When it was my turn to scan personal items I put my shoes, belt, and jacket into one bin and rolled it toward the TSA agent who assisted it onto a conveyor belt. As I waited in line to get scanned I watched the TSA agent speak to the woman who was behind me. She had put her jacket, shoes, and personal items on top of her laptop. Instead of asking her to go get a second bin he took her personal items and put them in my bin on top of my belongings. 

At first I was just upset that her shoes were on top of my jacket but in hindsight its more alarming than being respectful of travelers personal items. It's not that I think the woman behind me is bad person but what if the she had a weapon, drugs or paraphernalia in her jacket? Would I have been held liable since her items were in my bin? Would the TSA agent of accepted his wrongdoing if it escalated into questioning or conflict?

I'm not impressed with this lack of professionalism and violation of protocol. This TSA agent had no issue questioning travelers and calling them out when they weren't following rules but who is holding him accountable for taking short-cuts?

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: Friendly TSA agents! Always helpful when in a hurry. I travel a lot for work, and I feel like this are the most helpful. They normal don't have long lines

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: Rude, inexperienced and inconsistent.  One day a brush can go through the next day water can go through then all of a sudden you can get stopped for a necklace in your bag yes the same necklace.  I support their job 100%, I would just like consistency and customer awareness/humanity!

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: One star only because I have to select something. We were literally the only people in line and everyone we came in contact with were total DICKS. My DL still had three weeks left before EXP and the 12 year old checkpoint guy stared at my ID for two full minutes before saying "it's almost expired" (thanks captain obvious) and then proceeded to give my 8 and 10 year old kids the twice-over before getting to my wife. The basket lady was yelling at us to push our stuff through the x-ray machine without even raising a finger, and I do mean yelling. The last wand lady asked who the kids were with (remember we were the ONLY ones in line). Thank god we didn't have to get the wand or a cavity search. Too bad you can't tell these guys they're being dicks to their faces. Such a pretty airport to have such crappy security people working it.

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text:
Through the checkpoint, we had forgotten that our laptop needed to be out of the luggage, so one of the lady officers asked us to open it. My husband politely asked if he could help open the luggage to expedite the process. She then rudely said no, and slightly rolled her eyes. As soon as she got it out, she walked over to place our stuffs back on the conveyor. But instead of being careful, she slammed it down.

When she was done, she approached the other officers and chatted away. I was trying to get her name from her tag, but was avoiding me seeing it. She then said something like "I don't care" to the people with them.  

Be warned: some TSA officers are just unfriendly.

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text:
With all the negative reviews I had to share my positive one. First off, from all the airports I've visited in the country this airport has the friendliest TSA agents BY FAR. 

I had to have my carry on inspected further and I somehow during the process misplaced my cell phone (which housed my ID, credit cards and boarding pass in the phone case). The TSA agent did everything they could do to find my phone. They called it, they reran all my bags, and they started to look through every single bin. 

They finally found my phone, and they were so friendly though the whole ordeal. Thank you PHX TSA for the added touch of personal service. Thank you!!

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: They are mean, rude, and DO NOT COMMUNICATE WELL.They all need to be retrained or get another job. Everyone is not wired to work with the public. It's clear Phoenix hired a bunch of TSA employees with no customer skills. That was my experience before noon on Monday,10/26/15. I can only imagine how bad it gets throughout the day.

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: Worst security checkpoint yet. Almost missed my plane because of a full un warranted body search.

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: Way too many TSA PreCheck participants these days.  20  minutes to get past screening.  Really?  More scanners and xray machines needed!

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text:
I really appreciate TSA for stealing my personal items out of my checked bags and then leaving a note inside telling me that my bag was searched. Probably the dumbest criminals ever. I hope you enjoy my Bose speaker. At least you stole the charger too, so that proves you're not totally retarded. 

"Protecting you and your fellow passengers" -TSA

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: Wow! So the folks who run TSA think the best think to do is shut down TSAPre because they do not have enough staff. Tell me what the hell about that makes sense. Hey let's shut down the line that moves people through the fastest. I would honestly rather take my chances with the old system. TSA is incompetent and has no idea what they are doing.

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: The TSA employees in this section are lazy and unfriendly. On the day before thanksgiving, one of the busiest traveling days of the year, the employees did not perform their duties properly or effectively. The line for TSA pre-check was closed even though it took over 30 mins to effectively move through the regular lines. The employees behaved lazily while also being unfriendly and choosing to hold conversations rather than conduct their paid duties. They held up many passengers because of their own arrogance rather than any creditable intelligence. I missed my my flight because of the mismanagement of this organization. No matter what time frame, I suggest not to rely on anything the TSA propaganda states

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text:
Oh the TSA Checkpoint...I often wonder how one ends up with this job; possibly some type of DMV referral process?  Pretty much a thankless job, and one that does not have a lot of great customer interactions.  

This one does get an 'A-OK' rating from me this time.  Traveling out of Phoenix to go back home.  The line was short, and the TSA Agents were actually friendly and a little chatty with us.  Maybe we caught them on an off day.  Either way this was a quick and painless process.

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: TSA did well for the morning of NYE... quick and surprisingly they didn't "feel me up and pat me down" this time.. weirdos....

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: I travel every week, PHX is my home airport and I am sorry to admit that TSA here is by far the WORST in the country!!!!  We have to have these people but NOT the attitude.

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text:
Think of your worst traveling experience. Add dysentry. Polio. Syphilis. The bubonic plague. That might just begin to sum up the furor one experiences here.

This airport has the worst TSA staff I've ever seen. Even worse than Philly. These people shouldn't have jobs. These TSA "agents" (or flunkies??) need to be trained how to use an x-ray machine, how to be efficient, and how to actually do work rather than use this time as a social hour for themselves. Monkeys would be a good substitute. 7 TSA sub-monkeys for one security line, and none of them were doing anything actually productive. The guy behind the x-ray machine monitor took more than 1/2 of everyone's bags out of the line to be separately scanned. Other TSA flunkies kept redirecting the line all over. A line that should have taken 10 minutes to get through took over 30 minutes. Oh, apparently they are also threatened by books...

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text:
One of the worst run TSA checkpoints I've ever seen, and I've flown out of a ton of airports, and ones much smaller than PHX.

I was flying out of B, but the B gates security were closed. Nevermind that I had just walked down there from a restaurant in the middle.

I arrived to the A gates to a total nightmare scenario. TSA Precheck was closed, as they like to do here. I was lucky enough to be in first class for my flight, so I used that lane. There were a bunch of people in that line, so I asked if I was in the right place. The girl in front of me said a TSA agent just came through and ambiguously said this lane or the next one was for Precheck. What followed was a free-for-all with people using the disabled/employee lane and the first class lane. 

I called for a TSA agent to come over and explain which line was which, but they just looked me in the eye and listened to my explanation of how everyone was confused and nobody knew which line was with. Nobody from TSA was willing to come over and take control of the situation. They were just letting everyone in in whatever order they fought their way to the front.

I ended up getting yelled at and threatened by another passenger who mistook me as the enemy. I was just trying to get TSA to, you know, do their job. I'm the good guy here, sticking up for the 90% of the line that was getting cut by more aggressive passengers. 

Anyway, 15 minutes later I made it through security. Chatted with a supervisor who more or less admitted it was a terribly run checkpoint. Apparently this is normal in PHX, as an airport employee ensured me I was right, and the lounge agents shared their experiences with this TSA checkpoint.

It's really too bad this review will make absolutely no difference, just as me talking to a supervisor or filing a formal TSA complaint will. TSA will continue to do their absolute minimum to complete their job tasks without any pride for their work.

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: Worse TSA staff I have ever met.  Complete buffoons and have the security guard power stuck up there ass

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: What a joke. The line is out the door. 5 guys standing around, and we are forced to pay for this... if I ran my business like this, my doors would be closed in a week.

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: They are severely understaffed. Got to the airport 2 hrs early and waited an hour to get through. People were nice but it was ridiculous to wait that long. This system needs to be corrected.

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text:
I'm so frustrated with TSA Checkpoint at Sky Harbor. Terminal 4-A checkpoint is a huge checkpoint which, on Sunday, is pretty much at max capacity all day. Business travelers like me travel out on Sunday and back on Thursday or Friday and depend on TSA Precheck to get me through security quickly.

You offer PreCheck services and take payments at your airport. Then you have PreCheck locations at your security screening areas, but you decide to CLOSE them around 5pm for who knows what reason! Why would you deny that service, THAT WE PAY FOR, on a busy commuter travel day!? The past 2 weeks when I've approached T4-A I've seen no less than 200 people queued up in the regular line and at least HALF of those people when asked have TSA Pre on their boarding pass. Are you trying to save some money by not staffing that location? Well I'd didn't get a discount when I paid into this service.

Do everyone a favor. Staff this checkpoint just like you do T4-B and help out the people to weekly keep this airport's lights on and everyone employed. We don't have a choice of another airport to fly American out of. You've got us by the b*lls. Please do the right thing and allow us to use the services we paid for.

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text:
I know TSA folks have a tough job... I fly frequently and I'm happy for you to search me any time any where because I know you are trying to keep us all safe... but I just ask that you be nice about it! 

The three TSA agents I just dealt with at Phoenix Sky Harbor were snarky and rude. I'm sorry I have two hip replacements!!! Sorry I rang your buzzers... I warned you in advance that I would. Sorry if YOUR PEOPLE put me in the wrong line. Take it up at your next staff meeting!  I'm seriously not OK with being treated with such disrespect just because I have an ADA issue. You three TSA agents owe me an apology. BE NICE! #TSA #phoenixairport #skyharbortsa #skyharborairport

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: Rude TSA agent at the checkpoint where they check ID and boarding passes. No one was at the checkpoint and the TSA agent was sitting alone at his stand. He made my wife go back to the sign that said "Wait for next available agent" and told here to wait until he told her to walk up to him. He then went on to lecture her about following directions. It was completely unnecessary, rude and condescending. I've been a supporter of the TSA until this point. Now I understand why people complain about their demeanor and Congress is critical of their performance.

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: TSA Eric Pathoff is a joke and racist. He is the worst person you want to get! It took us more than 30 minutes in line and had to get our bags extra screening, the way he would walk Talk and take he's sweet time acting like an asshole was the icing on the cake! TSA in Phoenix is too much! I had to get a supervisor to help with this situation.

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: Biggest waste of money ever!  The TSA Pre-check line is officially the first time traveler, stroller. Wheelchair, family, and employee lane!  So frustrating to pay for a service and it is overtaken by I experienced travelers. Thanks for nothing TSA !!

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: They are the rudest  undertrained idiots I have ever had a experience with ever. If this state is based on tourism they have a sad future. I will never come back.

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: Very upset with my experience with this checkpoint. First off I went to the precheck line with my number in hand because it wouldn't print on my boarding (no idea why) but the lady wouldn't accept it. There were two agents checking tickets right before security for a line that was ridiculously long. If my flight wasn't delayed I would've been sprinting to the gate or else I would've missed it

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: Terribly badly organized - closing security stations at will with no rhyme or reason making people endlessly wander around Phoenix airport. Your chances to miss your plane because of immensely long lines at TSA: immensely high! Best option: try not to go through Phoenix airport.

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: Friendly TSA staff was very helpful getting us through the line quickly and with the least amount of inconvenience. We got through the line in less than five minutes. Doesn't get much better unless you fly first class.

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: I was at Phoenix Sky harbor airport. Took 45 min to check in, another 45 min to wait in line for X-ray. After X-ray, this a hole took my kids 1 foot long plastic hockey sticks that I bought for them. He said they were dangerous. We were at a game in Phoenix New Years Eve, so much fun, until TSA...

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: If I could give them negative stars I would. Sitting in an airport after missing our connecting flight when we had an hour and a half layover. The guy at TSA was threatening to pat everyone down individually if we had anything in our carry-ons that weren't approved. All of the agents looked like they were hired at 2am after a star wars fan get together. Worst airport and staff I've ever encountered.

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: Horrible treatment of my non-verbal autistic 11 year old daughter.  Rude, barking orders at a child I told them could not understand them.  When I tried to help her they kept yelling at me.  We have flown all over the country with no issues.  This is the worst experience we have ever had at an airport.  Complaints officially filed with TSA and anyone else I can think of - horrible treatment of people.

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: Awful.  I fly 75,000+ miles a year.  PHX TSA and TSA Pre at both Terminals 2 and 4 are the worst.  Too many items which pass TSA at other airports-watches, belts etc don't make it here.  Today they made everyone take out ANY food items.  Really?  What is the paranoia here?  Further they are as slow as can be.

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text:
So, I have PreCheck, and I have an artificial hip.  I actually, stupidly, thought that PreCheck would actually get through TSA faster. Nope.  So in Phoenix, the PreCheck line has the metal detector, which means I have to wait to be wanded. So I normally tell them about my hip in the PreCheck line, so they send me over to another line with the body scanners, and my carry-on stays in the first line, but of course in those other lines you have to take off your shoes, coat, etc.  So I have to constantly tell them I'm PreCheck even if everyone else in line isn't, and of course they look at me like I'm an idiot. Why are you in this line if your PreCheck?

I guess nobody at TSA ever realized that MAYBE someone with PreCheck may actually have an artificial joint. I guess nobody ever figured that out.

Maybe TSA needs to all get together at a meeting, and figure out an organized way to handle EVERY type of passenger they might have. Then make sure EVERY TSA person knows this procedure.

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: Got stopped at the checkpoint because the douchebag agent didn't like the fact that I was trying to carry on two bowling balls. I've never had a problem with this before, but I was sent back to check-in where, of course, baggage check-in had closed. I was then forced to pay the annoying baggage fee, it was American, so we all know how much they suck, and reassigned to flight almost 7 hours later. Nothing on the TSA website about bowling equipment and no other reason has cost me an extra $50 and at least 7 hours. I'd like to complain, but nobody has any power when it comes to flying. If they want to screw you, they can and will. TSA, just like everything else connected to flying, sucks.

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: If I could give a negative star, I would!!!  You better pray that you are not a minority traveling from PHX.  The airport staff in general are helpful but TSA has major problems.  They purposely stopped my husband and myself to search our bags to make it difficult for us.  They unpacked almost all our belongings and  caused us to repack virtually everything.  They found nothing out of the ordinary!  I noticed that the other person they were checking were an African American gentlemen and a Hispanic woman.  I understand that discrimination occurs but they were so obvious about it.  It took me my surprise to say that least!

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: Wow is all I can say. As I didn't really have a problem with TSA I saw another passenger deal with these "gods gift to security " personnel. A passenger was only questioning why he always gets pulled out of line to have his computer checked. Passenger was not being rude at all. Then the manager of T-4 TSA walked pass me and said " what a **cking douch bag " I calmly stated to him that that was not good customer service and he told me, I'm not in customer service. Then I told him that my 12 year old daughter was standing right next to me. He looked at her and walked away. No oh I'm sorry or anything to me or my daughter. Maybe a little customer training is exactly what he needs.

name: TSA Checkpoint T-4 A - Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
text: One of the worst experiences on 5/31/17 in Pre-Check I have ever experienced.  Unfriendly and Unprofessional TSA agents.  My Mother who is on medical oxygen was made to wait 25 minutes while on her medical oxygen (battery approved flight approved) before they proceeded to finally take her through for a full pat down.  There was no reason to make her wait this long as they seemed to have plenty of staff. Due to having to check in for Assistance and Pre-Check with the airline before, I do not see a need to treat someone with a medical disability in this manner.  I hope that these reviews are seen by the correct people to improve the process.

name: GoodLife Fitness
text:
I decided to try out this location when I began working in the area. The employees were all really nice but I was not impressed with the gym. 

The gym is always crowded and it smells like sweat. It's kind of dirty and there are no windows. I really don't like working out in an area that feels like a basement. I enjoy looking outside and seeing nature when I run.

name: GoodLife Fitness
text: Where do I start. The only reason I'm giving it 2 stars and not 1 is because the check in desk girls are nice. This place is a MESS. Very disorganized, cluttered, and not efficient placement of torn apart equipment. Cardio equipment should all be upstairs. The main floor needs to be organized properly. You can't move without bumping into someone. Weights are just Ross's about the entire gym. Which I blame the gym for not enforcing members to re-rack weights. The guys locker room was a mess. Towels and trash all over.  They need a housekeeper to constantly be cleaning equipment and checking the locker rooms. Not impressed wouldn't pay to be a member.

name: GoodLife Fitness
text:
Fun facts

-Court#3 for Squash has a closed wooden covered door if you want some privacy.
-Only the first 2 courts have glass doors facing the gym. 
-You can only book the courts online 
-Leagues will be ending soon (last game is March6) - perfect time to join ^_^
-You can get a free 3 day pass if you have a friend that is a member (if you want to try the courts out)
-Bathrooms are still under renovations. 

xoxo
M.

name: GoodLife Fitness
text:
This is the worst Goodlife location I have ever been to. Unfriendly staff who never greet you. They would rather have side conversations between co-workers than make eye contact with you. Why do I pay $60+ a month for nobody to say "have a good workout sir"? 

Machines are old and in terrible condition. Maintenance is non existent at this location. I just did 4 plates of leg press and the machine wouldn't lock after, forcing me to beg for help or I would seriously injure myself. 

Stay away! You've been warned. Make the 15 min drive from Sq 1 and go to the newly built Heartland location.

name: GoodLife Fitness
text: They refused to let my wheelchair bound mother use their washroom. Thanks to the people working here she had to go home with poo covered pants. I will never use a GoodLife gym.

name: GoodLife Fitness
text:
Have used this gym for a few years.  I have tried a few of their group fitness classes  that are free for members. From my experience it  is excellent.  You are there to get a workout  and not worry about getting a socialization session in .  The best times to use the gym are between 2 am to 5 am, and 9pm-12 midnight. The one time you must avoid the gym is between  5 pm to 9 pm when the rush hour crowd comes.  You can get a good workout in  provided you are polite, assertive, and willing to share equipment. The rest of the  times  have a fair number of people like any other gym . 

THE GOOD
Automatic massage chairs, large variety of equipment, sauna, polite staff,  clean gym ( clean until people mess it up during the day), almost 24 hours availability: Opens on Mondays @ 6 om, stays 24 hours till Friday 9 pm,  On the Weekends It is 8 am -7pm

THE BAD 
Chest, biceps, arms machines, are always used during rush hour , not enough 25-45 lb dumbells to satisfy the demand of most people in the gym ,  the bikes are missing straps on the pedals, not enough air conditioning during the summer



If you know  why you are working out then this is the place for you to get  it  and enjoy the results.. If you are there to socialize, take selfies,lack social skills( you need them if you want to  work in on equipment,/get equipment)  then this is not the place  for you .

name: GoodLife Fitness
text: Too small for the amount of members in attendance. I feel like I wasted my 15.00 day pass fee. There were seriously lines to use each machine. The TRX bands seem to only be available for trainers and their clients, as well as the kettle bells. I left unsatisfied and not likely to return.

name: GoodLife Fitness
text: I was offered a family discount on my membership since my brother is a member but the associate had the audacity to completely turn away from her commitment and later on offered a "family discount" by hiking my brother's fees and matching mine to what he is paying now. How stupid do you have to be to be able to have the cheek to sell that to a mentally sound customer. All of this after having me wait 40 mins with an appointment. A big no no for me!

name: GoodLife Fitness
text:
Very quickly, here is my experience from last visit on July 12, 2016.

1. Not enough equipments/machines. You have to wait in line to use a machine. Most machines are not functional because they are very old. I felt like I went back in time like 1997. 
2. Too busy doesn't matter what time you go. 
3. Too small. They have 3 squash courts yet they don't have enough weights or working machines...can't get my head wrap around this ^.^
4. You will find 50/50 ratio between clients and trainers. I have never seen that many trainers in any goodlife fitness.
5. It smells
6. Not clean
7. They lie (I am disappointed GL management). Why put a big sign saying 24 hours when you are not open 24 hours 7 days a week. It only pisses people off!

There is another GL in 1 km radius. This would be your best bet as there are no other gyms in the area. The west mall gym is nice but that is a good 10 min drive.

PS, I would rather go to my condo gym than this place.

name: GoodLife Fitness
text:
Location is convenient for me
Working out at other good life locations is convenient.

This location.  Like the other comments say, it isn't clean.  I have the worst sense of smell, seriously can't smell much.  But when I come in to here and it reeks of sweat, I know it has to be damn strong if I notice!!

When I signed up I went in to ask questions and mentioned I was going to purchase through a corporate account.  Corporate gives me half off the prices they pitch in store.   They wouldn't let up trying to get me to pay their price which was double mine, trying to tell me it was a better deal.  How was was double the price a better deal?

And like another reviewer stated, I wasn't interested in the personal training, which they seem to be coached pretty hard to push.  As soon as I made that clear, they didn't seem that interested in dealing with me any further.  I'm guessing the rate of commission for the employee that makes the sale for personal training must be quite lucrative.

Gym can be very crowded at times, sometimes ridiculously so.  On the other hand, I went one time at 4AM and there was no crowd!  However, during after work or early morning sometimes it's just too busy.

Perhaps if they reorganized the place so that, for example, the two bicep curl machines were side by side instead of upstairs and downstairs it might help alleviate the congestion.

I used to belong to ClubOne on North Service road.  ClubOne is more expensive than GoodLife, but like they say, you get what you pay for.

I go to two GoodLife locations.  This one is walkable, the other one I need to drive to get there.   All things being equal, I'll go to the other location when I have the chance.

name: GoodLife Fitness
text:
Not terrible as per the 1* rating, but not 100% thrilled either about this location.

First of all, it ain't 24-hrs...despite what the sign says.  And that's fine, just remove that portion of the sign and replace it with the hours of operation, so people don't feel duped.  Then again, who the hell would want to work out at 3 in the morning??!!  Not me!

After dropping in a coupla times for the week pass that I was so generously provided with by Shanty, here are my observations:

The Good:
-  it's a fairly large facility, but the layout is somewhat subterranean, spread over different levels due to the location in the mall
-  change rooms/washrooms are newer and kept clean
-  UNISEX!!!  I *need* and prefer this
-  they have a GoodLife propaganda channel and I thought this was motivational with their quotes on health and statistics on nutrition
-  they offer RMT services (for a fee, of course!)
-  PTs seemed fit
-  lotsa machines & tvs set-up
-  squash courts, if that's your thing
-  I think they offer childcare...although I never saw this happening while I was there
-  Spin room and class room seemed large enough
-  PTs, not really the workers (re:  people who are picking up weights or cleaning things) seemed genuinely happy

The N.I.
-  subterranean feel can also be a bad thing too, you hafta get used to the unique layout, there are quite a few hidden nooks 'n crannies
-  the club itself could use a facelift (some weird stains on the ceilings)
-  since it's a large club, at Square One, the members are a mix of retired folks, 20-30s, and punky kids who think it's cool to throw their water bottle across the room...'cause they don't want to carry it (??), juiceheads who drop their weights and  eggs each other on with grunts
-  weights weren't in the right place
-  I'd say that at least half their machines looked old
-  more than half of their tvs were fuzzy or just plain frozen

The location is pretty convenient if you lived nearby &/or like to shop!  ;)

name: GoodLife Fitness
text: Very packed in the evening. Free weights section looks like a fish market. The only upside is the location.

name: GoodLife Fitness
text:
This is the fourth goodlife location I have been to over the years. Being at square one, it is definitely a busy busy place. I would suggest going very early or midday to avoid the massive after-work crowds. 
This location has two floors and the upstairs is basically the same as downstairs except it's a bit smaller and has older machines. Still a good place to sneak away to if you find the bottom crowded. A lot of the classes are very busy so I would suggest arriving a few minutes early to avoid either not being able to get in, or having to position yourself in a very odd spot of the room to fit.
The instructors are great! All very enthusiastic, and able to keep you engaged the entire time. There has never been a time when I've been bored in a class. 

My biggest (and really the only) issue is that there are no kettle bells - only those that belong to the personal trainers. I get that they have risks associated with them if people don't know how to use them, but the same can be said for anything else. 

Otherwise, excellent place to get your workout in!

name: GoodLife Fitness
text:
My least favourite GOODLIFE location. 
Poor design, feels crammed. 
Less than clean. Avoid.

name: GoodLife Fitness
text:
I will disagree with a number of reviews here..

-It's open "24hrs" since they open Monday at 6am, and don't close until Friday at 9, then open for Saturday, and Sunday. They never claimed it was 24/7.

-I do tend to go to the gym at around midnight at times and have friends who go before work around 4/5am. Some of us have busy schedules and it's nice to have a gym available at these times.

-the "smell" isn't bad, rather better than the new heartland location which is rather humid and musky 

-equipment is fine, most machines seem to work fine, at least the ones I use. 

-no crazy juice heads, no kids throwing bottles.

-not a very big gym. after all, it is inside a mall. (For this reason I go in the morning or preferably after 9pm when the "after work" gym goers have gone home

-you don't go to a gym to be greeted, though the staff will usually have a friendly hello/goodbye from my experience.

-they offer mediocre personal trainers like any other rec. gym
________________________
onto the gym;
-Has a aerobics/yoga room, cycling room, TRX equipment, 2 flat bench, 1 incline, 1 decline, 2 cages, 1 squat rack, and your usual machines & treadmills, rower, battle ropes, squash courts, massage chairs, and a couple fountains on the first floor.
-second floor has a couple machines, dumbells and benches, couple more treadmills,and spin bikes

name: GoodLife Fitness
text:
Decided to drop by and see if anything has changed since the last time I visited (2012). After this most recent visit I will definitely not return and would not recommend to others.

The facility is quite dirty and isn't well maintained. Although the change rooms have been renovated it is quite dirty. The lockers and floor are dirty, blech! 

The treadmills are outdated and looks dirty. There was gum stuck to the bottom of the drink holder that I was using. Dumbbells are placed in the wrong spots or either missing. Although there are spray bottles and paper towels to clean down equipment I saw maybe one person actually use it (besides myself).

This place is quite grimy and I definitely did not want to workout at this location for long. I sanitized my hands twice..that's how unclean this place is.

name: Sportster's
text: Great people, great food.  This place has a full bar with all the regular beer on tap plus 1 or 2 micro beers.  It's a small friendly place where the bar tender knows all her clients.

name: Sportster's
text:
This place has gone the way of all the dumps on the danforth.  it's dark no lights on, no music, and no they don't have food anymore, just the first week.  I would avoid at all cost.  at least the other shitty places like tommys, linsmore and eastenders actually have patrons (using that lightly) this place is depressing.  The owner tried to sell us beer she saved from the over-flow on tap yuck.  I'm all into saving on hydro but when you have to turn on lights to take a piss it's like hanging out at your grandmothers.  The asian food was ok but $$$ probably why it didn`t work out (they don't seem to be selling that anymore) there is a sign in the window for tea and toast for $2.95 lol.  I'm going to say something some may not like but if you don't have a clue on how to run a bar  (the greeks did it in the 70's no problem), why are you taking on the unknown.  I`ll leave it at that.  If you take a walk along the danny from donlands to coxwell you will notice all these crappy places sell beer and no food.  This is why places like Morgans avoid the domestic beer and charge large for food they don`t want any of the riff raff.

note: these are new owners the previous pete and jen sold.  they had great food and knew how to welcome u.  the new owner told me she owned a place at sherbourne and dundas...yucky pucky

name: Sportster's
text:
This was stop #2 on a recent pub crawl of divey bars on the Danforth I led. Compared to many of the places we stopped in, this one was a bit upscale.

The owner was nice and welcoming.  They offer karaoke.  Your draft selection is standard.  Prices were fair.  There is good seating and a patio out front.  

I might actually return here at some point.  It has a loveable "underdog" feel to it.

name: Sportster's
text: Literally the worst place I have ever been. I would give it zero stars if I could. My friend got 4 mozzarella sticks for $7,and they were the bad frozen kind. I got a Philly steak, there was no cheese, it was dry and the bread was rock hard and I'm pretty sure I tasted mould at some point -  didn't have more than 3 bites and didn't want to find out for sure. We complained to the waitress and she didn't take it off our bill. Incredibly disappointed, will never be back.

name: Sportster's
text: I think I have found my home bar in Toronto. I went to TKO down the street for karaoke I read about online and found out they don't do it anymore. The bartender referred me to this place. It looks like a hole from the outside. I've passed it a hundred times. Going inside it's nice enough. The paint is great. The place is clean. I was greeted by the bartender/waitress/karaoke host Lily dancing around and singing and yelling "Happy St Patricks". Sold immediately. Karaoke Friday and Saturday. Small beer selection on tap, but good enough. Six-ish dollars a pint. The locals were the friendliest I've encountered in Ontario. Walked in alone, walked out with three email addresses and many hugs. The kitchen is apparently open late but I wasn't hungry. Menu looked good. Mozza sticks. Burgers. Speghetti. Nachos. The usual. The singers were all great. Even though I'm average or worse at the singing everyone still clapped after my turn on stage. I'll be back next weekend.

name: Sportster's
text: I came to Sportster's on Friday, November 20th for karaoke and wound up going home exceptionally disappointed. We used to be regular visitors of the bar on weekends for karaoke nights, but I think tonight was our last visit. Ever since management changed hands this place has gone completely downhill. The patrons are rude (one called my boyfriend an a**hole tonight after the karaoke host messed up his turn) and the new karaoke host is completely disorganized and lackluster - she takes more time cracking jokes and singing songs of her own than letting people sing and plays favourites with the patrons. It's a bummer it's gone completely south, it used to be a fun, under the radar place to visit! On the hunt for a new bar so if you have any recos on the Danforth, let's hear them.

name: Sportster's
text:
This was the 8th and final stop of the night on the Dirty Danforth pub crawl. To be fair, because it was late in the evening, and I think it was my 11th or 12th pint, the memories are a little bit blurry. In a nutshell, I'd describe it as mostly harmless. 

It's one of those neighbourhood places that isn't interested in attracting attention or new clientele. The drinks were reasonably priced, the bar had plenty of TVs for those interested in catching the game and the service was pretty snappy, I think.

If you're looking for a cheap pint, a safe environment and potentially some live music or karaoke, Sportsters isn't a bad stop. Give it a chance.

name: Chula Taberna Mexicana
text:
My partner and I went to Chula to check it out the other night, and here's our general assessment: the food, drinks, and atmosphere (read: patio) were quite good; the service was not. Pricey, but not outrageous.

Food: We shared the pico de gallo, and I had a shrimp taco (although I'd ordered fish - see 'Service', below) and the mushroom burrito. 

We also shared the churro sundae and the fudge plate. Everything was very good - fresh, flavourful, satisfying, good portions, and not too heavy (except dessert, but hey, when you order a churro sundae you know what you're in for).

Drink: I had a cocktail, which was very nicely constructed; a good balance of sweet/dry. The beer selection looked good as well.

Atmosphere: we were outside on a sunny day on comfortable furniture - can't ask for more than that!

Service: Some of the issue can be chalked up to inexperience and understaffing, but a lot was a simple lack of polish and organization. I think the layout may also have contributed - pathways are a smidge tight and the bar seems to be a specific area of difficulty (although I usually expect to wait longer for a cocktail, the beer took even longer).

I want to be clear- everyone was very friendly, energetic and kind, which is the most important thing. However, all the staff seemed to lack important service basics - empty plates/glasses were left on the table throughout our meal; dishes went to the wrong table, or werethe wrong order; it took our neighbours 15 minutes to get water; servers were having what should have been private conversations about restaurant issues in front of diners, etc. etc.

I'm rooting for Chula, and I do recommend it! I just hope that the service issues can be sorted out before too long, and I can update this review :)

name: Chula Taberna Mexicana
text: Taco's were da bomb as expected. If they weren't they wouldn't last. Romantic and social setting.

name: Chula Taberna Mexicana
text:
